message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.AI

This paper proposes a new methodology to assess the risk of developmental dyslexia before students learn to read using a mixed neural model. The methodology involves training an auto-encoder and combining it with an optimized ordinal regression neural network. The paper focuses on the use of neural networks and machine learning techniques to assess the risk of developmental dyslexia, which suggests that it is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.CL (Computation and Language): This sub-category deals with natural language processing, which is relevant to the proposed methodology for assessing the risk of developmental dyslexia.
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category deals with the development of algorithms and models for machine learning, which is relevant to the proposed mixed neural model.
- cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing): This sub-category deals with the development of neural networks and other computational models inspired by the brain, which is relevant to the proposed methodology.
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): This sub-category deals with the analysis and interpretation of visual data, which may be relevant to the proposed methodology if visual tests are used to assess the risk of developmental dyslexia.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): This sub-category deals with the development of intelligent agents and systems, which is relevant to the proposed methodology for assessing the risk of developmental dyslexia using machine learning techniques.
